pr_title: Use multiple IovArray for writev when using io_uring based transport

timeline.message:
Use one IovArray for writev when using io_uring based transport

Motivation:

How we did manage the memory of writev was quite wasteful and could
produce a lot of memory overhead. We can just keep it simple by using
one IovArray. Once it is full we can just submit and clear it as at this
point the kernel did take over a copy and its safe to reuse

Modifications:

Use one IovArray and submit once it is full.

Result:

Less memory overhead and less code duplication

timeline.author: chrisvest

timeline.bodyText: one drawback would be that we reduce submission batch size when a lot of channel writing in the same time especially with a bigger message size, one solution would be: to make the capacity configurable, default iovec array size is only 1024 as far as I know
timeline.author: 1Jo1

replies.bodyText: yep I am aware of this... thats why I added some "we may want to adjust this later comment"... That said let me run some benchmarks for now first
replies.author: normanmaurer

timeline.bodyText: we could even make this more optimal by writing a custom IovArray implementation. But for now this seems to work well enough and allows us for code-reuse.
timeline.author: normanmaurer

replies.bodyText: I like that, 8 we should take it as default value when it's configurable
